CatDescriptText: Mrs. Marie Engel, housewife, 406 Beltzhoover Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "I don't think so. I have a daughter and I hope that she waits until she is around 19 or 20 years of age before she begins to smoke.  A child under that age is just too young to smoke."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marie Engel wearing light colored blouse, dark jacket, and light colored short gloves, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
